item.title: FShader Widget
item.description:
I’ve always been a fan of ShaderToy and its co-founder Inigo Quilez. I remember seeing one of his early presentations (sadly I can’t find it anymore) about the incredible things you can do with fragment shaders alone.

But I’ve always had one gripe: to create or view shaders, you have to go to ShaderToy’s website. Since ShaderToy uses browser APIs that are available everywhere, shaders should be shareable and embeddable anywhere. The setup code is the same for every shader, so it can be abstracted away into a reusable widget.

item.title: Tools I Use
item.description:
Terminal tools

  • tmux
  • nvim via lazyvim
  • vim - when I’m in a hurry and don’t have time to setup lazyvim

Oh My Themes

These themes are incredibly convenient. I want my terminal to look good and be functional, but I prefer not to spend much time setting it up when starting on a new machine. The “Oh My *” themes offer attractive defaults and make customization easy, being an excellent starting point for any setup.
